name: accessible-autocomplete
description: An autocomplete component, built to be accessible.
readme:
# Accessible autocomplete

The accessible autocomplete is a component that helps users choose answers from a list you provide. You can also use it to
summary: The repository provides an accessible autocomplete component designed to help users select answers from a predefined list. It ensures improved usability and accessibility, adhering to standards for users with disabilities. The component can be customized and integrated into various applications to enhance user experience.

name: hamagen-react-native
description: Israel's Ministry of Health's COVID-19 Exposure Prevention App
readme:
# Hamagen
![Build](https://github.com/MohGovIL/hamagen-react-native/workflows/Build/badge.svg)
[![CodeCov](https://codecov.io/gh/MohGovIL/hamagen-reac
summary: Hamagen is a COVID-19 exposure prevention app developed by Israel's Ministry of Health. Built using React Native, the app helps users determine potential exposure to confirmed COVID-19 cases by cross-referencing their location history with epidemiological data. It prioritizes user privacy by conducting all data processing locally on the device. The repository includes the app's source code, build instructions, and relevant documentation.

name: falcon
description: Falcon: The Hyperledger Fabric Deployment Helper for Kubernetes is an open-source project designed to streamline the deployment and management of Hyperledger Fabric based blockchain networks on K8.
readme:
## Falcon: Hyperledger Fabric Deployment Helper for Kubernetes

[![NPCIOSS Lifecycle](https://img.shields.io/badge/oss_lifecyce-active-green)](OSSMETA
summary: Falcon is an open-source tool designed to simplify the deployment and management of Hyperledger Fabric blockchain networks on Kubernetes. It provides automated workflows and configurations to streamline setup, ensuring scalability and ease of use for blockchain applications. Ideal for developers and organizations working with Hyperledger Fabric, Falcon enhances efficiency and reduces manual effort in Kubernetes-based environments.

name: pdf2md

# pdf2md

JavaScript npm library to parse PDF files and convert them into Markdown

See [Releases](https://github.com/opendocsg/pdf2

For details on updates and changes, users can refer to the [Releases](https://github.com/opendocsg/pdf2).

summary: This repository provides a form builder platform designed for the Singapore Government, enabling the creation and management of digital forms. It features tools tailored for secure, efficient, and user-friendly form generation, catering to public sector needs. The platform supports easy deployment and scalability while adhering to government standards.

It includes an efficient setup for running data pipelines seamlessly in distributed computing environments. name: Open_First_Whitepaper

readme:
(Le français suit)

# Open First Whitepaper (DRAFT)

The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat is writing this whitepaper to pull together our thinking
summary: The "Open First Whitepaper" is a draft document being developed by the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat to consolidate its perspectives on open practices. It aims to outline strategies and principles for adopting openness in government processes, with a specific focus on transparency, collaboration, and innovation. The repository serves as a working space for drafting and refining this whitepaper. Content is bilingual, with portions available in English and French.

name: geo-deep-learning
description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets
readme:
![Logo](./docs/img/logo.png)

## **About**

The **Geo-Deep-Learning** project stems from an initiative at NRCan's [CCMEO](https://www.nrcan.gc.ca/ear
summary: The **Geo-Deep-Learning** repository focuses on applying deep learning techniques to georeferenced datasets. Developed by NRCan's CCMEO, the project aims to leverage advanced machine learning methods for geospatial analysis and processing. It is designed to enable users to explore, train, and deploy deep learning models for various geospatial applications effectively.

summary: FGI-GSRx is an open-source multi-GNSS software receiver developed by FGI. It supports research and development in GNSS technologies, including resistance to jamming and spoofing. The repository links to GNSS jamming and spoofing datasets for further exploration and testing.

summary: ECL (Europa Component Library) is a design system and component library for building consistent and reusable user interfaces, primarily designed for Europa, the European Commission's web platform. The library includes styled components and follows coding standards such as Prettier for code formatting. It aims to streamline UI development and maintain design consistency across projects.

name: oobee
description: Oobee (formerly known as Purple A11y) is a customisable, automated web accessibility testing tool that allows software development teams to find and fix accessibility problems to improve persons with disabilities (PWDs) access to digital services.
readme:
# Oobee (CLI)

[Oobee](https://go.gov.sg/oobee-cli) (formerly known as Purple A11y) is a customisable, automated accessibility testing tool that allow
summary: Oobee is a customizable, automated web accessibility testing tool designed to help software development teams identify and address accessibility issues, enhancing digital service access for people with disabilities (PWDs). Previously known as Purple A11y, it is available as a CLI tool and aims to streamline the process of improving web accessibility. The tool supports automated testing and customization to fit various project needs.

summary: SUMO (Search for Unidentified Maritime Objects) is a Java-based software package designed for ship detection. Users should exercise caution due to its outdated state.

name: rn-contact-tracing
description: React Native Library For Contact Tracing Over BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) To Fight COVID-19 Pandemic

summary: RN-Contact-Tracing is a React Native library designed for contact tracing using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technology to help combat the COVID-19 pandemic. It enables cross-platform integration for tracking interactions between users' devices while maintaining privacy and anonymity. The library is available via npm and serves as a tool for developers to create contact tracing applications efficiently.

name: HASlib
description: Galileo High Accuracy Service decoder library
readme:
# HASlib

The Galileo HAS Decoder library is a repository for Python 3, capable of decoding raw Galileo C/Nav pages received by an E6 capable signal r
summary: The Galileo HAS Decoder library (HASlib) is a Python 3-based tool designed to decode raw Galileo C/Nav pages obtained from E6-capable signals. It facilitates the extraction of high-accuracy service (HAS) data provided by Galileo navigation satellites. The library is tailored for applications requiring precise satellite navigation data processing.

name: crawl

[![crawl status
badge](https://dsjohnson.r-universe.dev
summary: This repository provides an R package designed for modeling animal movement using continuous-time correlated random walk (CTCRW) models. It facilitates the analysis of movement data, allowing researchers to effectively capture and interpret spatial and temporal patterns in animal trajectories. The package is equipped with tools for fitting and simulating movement models, enabling robust ecological and behavioral studies.

summary: Caddy is an AI-powered chatbot designed to serve as a co-pilot for customer service functions. description: Face segmentation algorithm that the VigilantGantry uses to identify potential missed out causes by current thermal systems (due to occlusion from fringe, cap, head-gear).

summary: The VigilantGantry repository provides a Python-based face segmentation algorithm designed to identify areas potentially missed by thermal imaging systems due to occlusions like fringe, caps, or headgear. The tool enhances the accuracy of detecting such occlusions, making thermal systems more reliable in critical applications. It is compatible with Python 3.7 and prioritizes precision in face segmentation for improved thermal analysis.

name: TDBSCAN
description: TDBSCAN with Move Ability: Spatiotemporal Density Clustering
readme:
![python versions](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.6.4-blue.svg)

TDBSCAN
======
Python implementation of [TDBSCAN: Spatiotemporal Density
Clust
summary: This repository provides a Python implementation of TDBSCAN, an extension of DBSCAN tailored for spatiotemporal clustering with support for mobility. The method identifies clusters based on spatial and temporal constraints, making it suitable for analyzing moving objects or dynamic datasets. It is compatible with Python 3.6.4 and focuses on density-based clustering in spatiotemporal domains.
